page.title: 01Hopsay Hamlet S Shropshire
page.content: Hopsay is an hamlet of a dozen, mostly large, houses, set between Burrow & Hopesay Hills. The valley has many trees with a few specimen Gient American Redwood & a Monkey Puzzle Trees. The slopes of Hopsey Hill are brcken covered but higher the short grass is grazed by sheep & horses, which are still ridden at round up time. On the boggy levels the rare bog pimpernel & carniverous sundew plants are found. The 12th century church is tucked beneath Burrow Hill which as slopes planted with conifers up to the ancient hill fort on the top. Farming is the chief occupation sheep/cattle/little arable, but many residents are newcomers in passed 12 years - playwright, architect, holiday flat prop, pharmacist, optician. All have chosen to live here. Superb place to live. Hopesay farm in \
